revised_title: Supplementary Note on Polacanthus Foxii: Dorsal and Endoskeleton Analysis
tldr: This article describes the large dorsal shield of the dinosaur Polacanthus Foxii, which has been recently restored and shows a more complete dermal armature than any other dinosaur. The author also discusses the pelvis structure, which is different from that of the Iguanodont family. Additionally, the article mentions a scorpion's self-inflicted death phenomenon and various experiments related to it.
